meanings.definition: The step or sill at a doorway.
meanings.sent1: I tripped on the doorstep and almost fell.
meanings.sent2: Please wipe your feet on the doorstep before entering.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat on the doorstep waiting for its owner to return.
meanings.sent4: The doorstep welcomed visitors into the cozy home.
meanings.sent5: The doorstep creaked under the weight of the delivery person.

meanings.definition: To place or leave on or at a doorstep.
meanings.sent1: She doorsteped the package outside the neighbor's house.
meanings.sent2: He doorsteped the letter for the postman to collect.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids doorsteped a fake spider to scare their friend.
meanings.sent4: The company doorsteped the invitation to the event.
meanings.sent5: The teacher doorsteped the homework assignment on time.
